title.narrative: Strengthening COVID-19 Response in Timor-Leste's Border Communities Phase II (SCRIT-LBC Phase II)

description.narrative: Cross-border human mobility has been drastically impacted by the Covid-19 pandemic, with border closures and travel restrictions of unparalleled scale. As restrictions begin to ease and governments around the world contemplate removing mobility restrictions and reopening borders, the Government of Timor-Leste needs to take into account how to effectively manage cross-border mobility while safeguarding public health. Timor-Leste is characterized by dynamic migration flows. It is experiencing increased rates of international migration – both regular and irregular, facilitated by the porous borders with Indonesia. Following the detection of the first case of Covid-19 in Timor-Leste, the Government of Timor-Leste has been making tremendous efforts in preventing the spread of the virus, but these efforts can be undermined if effective preventive measures are not in place at ports of entry and border crossing points. Guided by the Health, Border & Mobility Management (HBMM) framework, the proposed project contributes to the government of Timor-Leste’s efforts to prevent the risks of cross-border disease transmission, taking into consideration mobility dynamics and cross border movements through capacity building to frontline border officials, flow monitoring for evidence based health interventions and improved border management response, and awareness raising among border communities and mobile population.

mailing-address.narrative: UN House, Building 09 Caicoli Street, Dili, Timor-Leste

sector.narrative: Facilitation of orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration and mobility

policy-marker.narrative: Project with some but insufficient inclusion of gender issues
